title: When is a retired jersey number off limits for a top prospect ? ( Podcast )
body_text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio — Top MLB prospect Jackson Holliday caused a stir when he asked Baltimore to wear No. 7 this week in his major league debut. The number had been unofficially retired by the club after Cal Ripken Sr. last wore it. How would Holliday’s request have gone over if he played for the Yankees and wanted to wear Mickey Mantle’s No. 7 or Boston wearing Ted Williams’ No. 9?
On Friday’s podcast, Paul Hoynes and Joe Noga talked about when a prospect asking to wear a retired number is OK and when something like that would not fly. Could you imagine anybody asking to wear No. 19 in Cleveland?
They also preview the upcoming Yankees series and look at the latest Shohei Ohtani news.
Listen and read along with an AI-generated transcript of the podcast below.
